string-array.name: World_Trade_Park_highlights
string-array.item: Shivamogga, also known as Shimoga, is a picturesque city located in the state of Karnataka, India.
It is renowned for its lush greenery, serene landscapes, and vibrant culture
Rice Bowl of Karnataka
The Tunga River, a major tributary of the Tungabhadra River, originates in the Western Ghats near Shimoga.
Preferred month: October-February.
640 meter(2100-ft) from sea level.

string-array.name: Abhaneri_Stepwall_highlights
string-array.item: Yana, located in Karnataka, is renowned for its unique rock formations and is a popular destination for trekking and adventure enthusiasts.
The trek to Yana offers breathtaking views of the surrounding forests and hills, making it a picturesque destination for nature lovers.
Yana is also a pilgrimage site, with a cave temple dedicated to Lord Shiva located at the base of the rock formations. Many trekkers visit the temple as part of their trekking experience.
Preferred month: Rainy season.
Elevation:380 meter(1247-ft) from sea level.

string-array.name: Galta_ji_highlights
string-array.item: Gumbe, Karnataka, is renowned for its picturesque hill station, offering stunning views and a peaceful atmosphere.
The region is known for the ancient Gumbeeshwara Temple, its historical significance attracts visitors interested in exploring its heritage.
Preferred month: October-February.
Elevation:300 meter (984-ft) from sea level.

string-array.name: birla_Mandir_highlights
string-array.item: Kudremukh is situated in the Western Ghats range of Karnataka, about 95 kilometers (59 miles) from the city of Mangalore.
Kudremukh is also home to the Kudremukh National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its conservation efforts and pristine natural beauty.
The landscape of Kudremukh is characterized by rolling hills, lush forests, grasslands, and streams, making it a picturesque destination for nature lovers.
Preferred month:October-February or Rainy season.
Elevation:1894 meter(6,114-ft) from sea level.

string-array.name: Akshardham_highlights
string-array.item: Kumara Parvatha, also known as Pushpagiri, is located in the Western Ghats of Karnataka, near the town of Somwarpet in the Kodagu (Coorg) district.
Trekkers are required to obtain permits from the Forest Department before starting the trek, as Kumara Parvatha is located within the Pushpagiri Wildlife Sanctuary.
Preferred month: Monsoon season.
Elevation:1,712 meter(5,617-ft) from sea level.

string-array.name: Central_Park_highlights
string-array.item: Kote Dagge is located near Dharmasthala in the Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka, India.
The trek to Kote Dagge is known for its scenic beauty, with lush greenery, waterfalls, and the peaceful surroundings of the Western Ghats.
There are no accommodation facilities available at Kote Dagge, so it is advisable to carry tents and camping equipment if planning to stay overnight.
It is also recommended to trek in groups and follow the instructions of local guides.
Preferred month:October-February
Elevation:800 meter(2,625-ft) from sea level.

string-array.name: Rajasthani_Food_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Starts from the Solang Valley near Manali and leads to the source of the Beas River, the Beas Kund.
Duration: Typically a 2-3 day trek.
Altitude:Approximately 3,700 meters (12,139 feet).
Preferred month: May to October, when the weather is pleasant.

string-array.name: BBQ_Nation_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Starts from Manali and crosses the Hampta Pass into the Lahaul Valley.
Duration: Usually takes around 4-5 days to complete.
Altitude: The highest point of the trek is Hampta Pass at an altitude of approximately 4,270 meters (14,010 feet).
Preferred month: Mid-June to mid-October, avoiding the monsoon season.

string-array.name: Virasat_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Starts from the village of Barsheni near Manikaran in Himachal Pradesh and crosses the Pin Parvati Pass into the Pin Valley National Park.
Duration: Generally takes around 10-12 days to complete.
Altitude: The Pin Parvati Pass is at an altitude of approximately 5,319 meters (17,450 feet), making it one of the highest passes in the Indian Himalayas.
Preferred month: Mid-June to September, but it is a challenging trek and requires proper acclimatization.

string-array.name: Jaipur_Adda_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Starts from Batal in the Spiti Valley and leads to Chandratal Lake.
Duration: Usually a 2-3 day trek.
Altitude: Chandratal Lake is located at an altitude of around 4,300 meters (14,100 feet).
Preferred month: June to September, but it is accessible only during the summer months due to heavy snowfall in winter.

string-array.name: ZoloCrust_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Starts from Gulaba near Manali and leads to Bhrigu Lake.
Duration: Typically a 2-3 day trek.
Altitude: Bhrigu Lake is located at an altitude of approximately 4,300 meters (14,100 feet).
Preferred month: May to June and September to October. Chandratal Trek:

string-array.name: Rajput_Room_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Starts from McLeod Ganj near Dharamshala in Himachal Pradesh.
Duration: Usually a 1-2 day trek, depending on the starting point.
Altitude: Triund is at an altitude of around 2,850 meters (9,350 feet).
Preferred month: March to June and September to December, avoiding the monsoon season.

string-array.name: Fairmont_highlights
string-array.item: Location: In the villages around Cherrapunji and Mawlynnong.
Highlights: Trek through dense forests and witness unique living root bridges.
Difficulty: Easy to moderate.
Elevation: Nearly 314 meters(1,030-ft) from sea level.
Preferred month: October to May.

string-array.name: Ibis_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Located at the border of Nagaland and Manipur.
Highlights: Known for its lush green valleys, seasonal flowers, and streams.
Difficulty: Moderate.
Elevation: Nearly 2,800 meters(11,000-ft) from sea level.
Preffered month: June to September.

string-array.name: Radission_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Starting from Yuksom in Sikkim, leading to the Goechala Pass.
Highlights: Offers breathtaking views of Kanchenjunga, the third-highest mountain in the world.
Difficulty: Moderate to difficult.
Preferred month: April to June, September to November.
Elevation: 4,940 meters(16,240-ft) from sea level.

string-array.name: Meridian__highlights
string-array.item: Location: Near Tawang in Arunachal Pradesh.
Highlights: Trek through picturesque landscapes to reach the stunning Nuranang Falls.
Difficulty: Easy to moderate.
Elevation: 100 meters(6,000-ft) from sea level.
Preferred month: March to October.

string-array.name: Oberoi_Palace_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Near Tawang in Arunachal Pradesh.
Highlights: Offers stunning views of the Sela Lake and surrounding mountains.
Difficulty: Moderate.
Elevation: 4,170 meter(13,700-ft) from sea level.
Preferred month: April to June, September to November.

string-array.name: Rajasthan_Palace_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Starts from Manebhanjan in West Bengal and ends at Phalut.
Highlights: Panoramic views of the Himalayan range including Everest and Kanchenjunga.
Difficulty: Moderate.
Elevation: 3,636 meter(11,929-ft) from sea level.
Preferred month: April to June, September to November.

string-array.name: uv
string-array.item: Location: Near Rajapalayam in the Western Ghats.
Highlights: Trek to the Ayyanar Falls and enjoy the beauty of the surrounding hills. The trek offers a chance to explore the rich flora and fauna of the region.
Difficulty: Easy to moderate.
Elevation: The starting point of the trek is at an elevation of approximately 250 meters (820 feet).
Preferred Month: September to March, when the falls are at their best due to the monsoon season.

string-array.name: Albert_hall_highlights
string-array.item: Highlights: Trek through forests, waterfalls, and grasslands, with views of the Western Ghats. Popular routes include the Dolphin Nose trek, Green Valley View trek, and the Perumal Peak trek.
Difficulty: Easy to moderate.
Elevation: Kodaikanal is situated at an elevation of approximately 2,133 meters (6,998 feet).
Preferred Month: October to March, when the weather is pleasant.

string-array.name: Amber_Fort_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Kolli Hills near Namakkal.
Highlights: Trek to the Agaya Gangai waterfalls and witness the beauty of the Kolli Hills. The trek also offers panoramic views of the surrounding valleys and forests.
Difficulty: Moderate.
Elevation: The highest point in Kolli Hills is Mount Kolli at an elevation of approximately 1,450 meters (4,760 feet).
Preferred Month: September to March, when the weather is cool and pleasant.

string-array.name: Nahargarh_Fort_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Near Munnar in the Western Ghats.
Highlights: Trek to the highest tea estate in the world, offering stunning views of the surrounding hills and valleys. The trek also provides an opportunity to witness tea-making processes.
Difficulty: Moderate.
Elevation: The trek starts at an elevation of approximately 1,700 meters (5,577 feet) and reaches up to around 2,170 meters (7,119 feet).
Preferred Month: September to May, avoiding the monsoon season.

string-array.name: Jantar_Mantar_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Meghamalai in the Western Ghats.
Highlights: Trek through dense forests and tea estates, with views of the surrounding hills. The trek offers a peaceful and serene environment, away from the hustle and bustle of city life.
Difficulty: Moderate.
Elevation: Meghamalai is situated at an elevation of approximately 1,500 meters (4,920 feet).
Preferred Month: September to March, when the weather is cool and pleasant.

string-array.name: Jal_Mahel_highlights
string-array.item: Location: Yercaud in the Shevaroy Hills.
Highlights: Trek through forests and coffee plantations, with views of the Eastern Ghats. The trek also offers a chance to visit the Lady Seat viewpoint and the Kiliyur Falls.
Difficulty: Easy to moderate.
Elevation: Yercaud is situated at an elevation of approximately 1,515 meters (4,970 feet).
Preferred Month: October to June, avoiding the monsoon season.
